    <p>Por que você deve atualizar o seu navegador?

<ul>

<li><b>Aumento na Segurança</b><br>Esteja melhor protegido contra vírus, cavalos de tróia e outras ameaças.</li>

<li><b>Aumento na Velocidade</b><br>Diminua o tempo de espera no carregamento das páginas.</li>
        
<li><b>Aumento na Grandiosidade</b><br>Melhore a forma com que os websites são exibidos e a sua experiência de navegação.</li>

</ul></p>

    (function() {
  var Tracker = {};

  Tracker.track = function(eventName, data) {
    var url = "https://support.riotgames.com/hc/tracking/events?locale=pt-br";

    var payload = {
      "event": eventName,
      "data": data,
      "referrer": document.referrer
    };

    var xhr = new XMLHttpRequest();

    xhr.open("POST", url, true);
    xhr.setRequestHeader("Content-Type", "application/json; charset=UTF-8");
    xhr.send(JSON.stringify(payload));
  };

    Tracker.track("front_page_viewed", "BAh7AA==--50d1974e05bddc24bd4b43467913737de44d3c7e");
})();

	}

<script>
var myIndex = 0;
carousel();

function carousel() {
    var i;
    var x = document.getElementsByClassName("mySlides");
    for (i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
       x[i].style.display = "none";
    }
    myIndex++;
    if (myIndex > x.length) {myIndex = 1}
    x[myIndex-1].style.display = "block";
    setTimeout(carousel, 8000); // Change image every 8 seconds
}
</script>

			<h3 class="mvp-feat2-main-cat left"><span class="mvp-feat2-main-cat left">News</span></h3>
			<div class="mvp-feat2-main-title left relative">
									<h2 class="mvp-stand-title">Samsung E-Festival Instrumental abre inscrições para bandas e artistas solo</h2>
							</div><!--mvp-feat2-main-title-->
			<div class="mvp-feat1-info">
				<span class="mvp-blog-author">By Da redação</span><span class="mvp-blog-date"><i class="fa fa-clock-o"></i><span class="mvp-blog-time">27 de março de 2017</span></span>
			</div><!--mvp-feat1-info-->
		</div><!--mvp-feat2-main-text-->
		</a>
	</div><!--mvp-feat2-main-->
			<div class="mvp-feat2-sub left relative">
		<a href="http://www.revistalounge.com.br/joias-finas-samba-e-axe-confira-quem-passou-pelo-coquetel-da-joalheria-corsage-e-pela-primeira-edicao-da-farofada/" rel="bookmark">
		<div class="mvp-feat2-sub-img left relative">

		</a>
		<div class="mvp-feat2-sub-text-before left relative">
			<div class="mvp-feat2-sub-text">
				<h3 class="mvp-feat2-sub-cat"><span class="mvp-feat2-sub-cat">Social</span></h3>
				<a href="http://www.revistalounge.com.br/joias-finas-samba-e-axe-confira-quem-passou-pelo-coquetel-da-joalheria-corsage-e-pela-primeira-edicao-da-farofada/" rel="bookmark"><h2>Joias finas, samba e axé. Confira quem passou pelo coquetel da Joalheria Corsage e pela primeira edição da Farofada</h2></a>
				<div class="mvp-feat1-info">
					<span class="mvp-blog-author">By <a href="http://www.revistalounge.com.br/author/redacao/" title="Posts de Da redação" rel="author">Da redação</a></span><span class="mvp-blog-date"><i class="fa fa-clock-o"></i><span class="mvp-blog-time">27 de março de 2017</span></span>
				</div><!--mvp-feat1-info-->
			</div><!--mvp-feat2-sub-text-->
		</div><!--mvp-feat2-sub-text-before-->
	</div><!--mvp-feat2-sub-->
		<div class="mvp-feat2-sub left relative">
		<a href="http://www.revistalounge.com.br/do-bem-restaurante-la-peruana-tem-menu-beneficente-para-ajudar-cidade-afetada-pelo-el-nino/" rel="bookmark">
		<div class="mvp-feat2-sub-img left relative">
							<img width="400" height="240" src="http://www.revistalounge.com.br/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/la-peruana_prato-400x240.jpeg" class="attachment-mvp-mid-thumb size-mvp-mid-thumb wp-post-image" alt="" />								</div><!--mvp-feat2-sub-img-->
		</a>
		<div class="mvp-feat2-sub-text-before left relative">

<!-- ngg_resource_manager_marker --><script type='text/javascript' src='https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/js/devicepx-jetpack.js?ver=201713'></script>
<script type='text/javascript' src='http://www.revistalounge.com.br/wp-content/themes/click-mag/js/mvpcustom.js?ver=4.7.3'></script>
<script type='text/javascript'>

	jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
	$(window).load(function(){
	var aboveHeight = $("#mvp-head-top").outerHeight();
	$(window).scroll(function(event){
	    	if ($(window).scrollTop() > aboveHeight){
	    		$("#mvp-nav-wrap").addClass("mvp-fixed").css("top","0");
	    		$("#mvp-main-wrap").addClass("mvp-fixed-next");
			$(".mvp-fly-top").addClass("mvp-to-top");
	    	} else {
	    		$("#mvp-nav-wrap").removeClass("mvp-fixed");
	    		$("#mvp-main-wrap").removeClass("mvp-fixed-next");
	    		$(".mvp-fly-top").removeClass("mvp-to-top");
	    	}
	});
	});
	});
	

	jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
	// Main Menu Dropdown Toggle
	$(".menu-item-has-children a").click(function(event){
	  event.stopPropagation();
	  location.href = this.href;
  	});

	$(".menu-item-has-children").click(function(){
    	  $(this).addClass("toggled");
    	  if($(".menu-item-has-children").hasClass("toggled"))
    	  {
    	  $(this).children("ul").toggle();
	  $(".mvp-fly-nav-menu").getNiceScroll().resize();
	  }
	  $(this).toggleClass("tog-minus");
    	  return false;
  	});

	// Main Menu Scroll
	$(window).load(function(){
	  $(".mvp-fly-nav-menu").niceScroll({cursorcolor:"#888",cursorwidth: 7,cursorborder: 0,zindex:999999});
	});
	});
	

	jQuery(document).ready(function($) {
	$(".infinite-content").infinitescroll({
	  navSelector: ".mvp-nav-links",
	  nextSelector: ".mvp-nav-links a:first",
	  itemSelector: ".infinite-post",
	  errorCallback: function(){ $(".mvp-inf-more-but").css("display", "none") }
	});
	$(window).unbind(".infscr");
	$(".mvp-inf-more-but").click(function(){
   		$(".infinite-content").infinitescroll("retrieve");
        	return false;
	});
	$(window).load(function(){
		if ($(".mvp-nav-links a").length) {
			$(".mvp-inf-more-but").css("display","inline-block");
		} else {
			$(".mvp-inf-more-but").css("display","none");
		}
	});
	});
	
</script>

          <div class='aba'>
              <a href='/s/ajuda.html'>Ajuda</a>
          </div>
      </div>
  </li>
</ul>
</nav>
</div>

<script>
  function fixMenuOnScroll() {
      var menu = $('#menu');
      var geral = $('#geral');
      var offSetMenu = 118;
      $(window).scroll(function () {
          var offSetWindow = $(window).scrollTop();
          if (offSetWindow >= offSetMenu) {
              menu.addClass('menu-fixed');
              geral.addClass('geral-absolute');
          } else {
              menu.removeClass('menu-fixed');
              geral.removeClass('geral-absolute');
          }
      });
  }
  
  fixMenuOnScroll();
  
  var calculatadeMenu = false;

  function larguraSubmenus() {
      var aba, paddingR, totalAba, container, retorno;
      $('#menu li.sub').each(function () {
          aba = $(this).find('.aba').width();
          paddingR = $(this).find('.aba').css('padding-right').replace('px', '');
          totalAba = aba + parseInt(paddingR);
          container = $(this).find('.conteudoSubMenu').width();
          retorno = container - totalAba;
          if ($(this).hasClass('last')) {
              if (($(this).position().left + $(this).find('.conteudoSubMenu').width()) > 988) {
                  $(this).find('.conteudoSubMenu').css('left', function () {
                      return '-' + retorno + 'px'
                  });
              }
          }
      });
      calculatadeMenu = true;
  }
  $('#buscar').focus(function () {
      $('#buscaGoogle').addClass('getFocus');
  });
  $('#buscar').blur(function () {
      $('#buscaGoogle').removeClass('getFocus');
  });
  $('#menu h2 a').hover(function () {
      if (!calculatadeMenu) {
          larguraSubmenus();
      }
      $(this).closest('li').find('.menuContainer').css({
          visibility: "visible"
      }).animate({
          opacity: 1
      }, 50, function () {});
  }, function () {
      openedMenu = setTimeout(function (obj) {
          $('.menuContainer').animate({
              opacity: 0
          }, 50, function () {
              $(this).css({
                  visibility: "hidden"
              })
          })
      }, 300);
  });
  $('#menu .menuContainer').hover(function () {
      $(this).closest('li').find('.menuContainer').css({
          visibility: "visible",
          opacity: 1
      });
      clearInterval(openedMenu);
  }, function () {
      $(this).animate({
          opacity: 0
      }, 50, function () {
          $(this).css({
              visibility: "hidden"
          })
      })
  });
</script>

      <!-- INICIO BARRA LATERAL -->
<script>
	function formatarTempo(d, id){
	seconds = Math.floor(d / 1000);
	minutes = Math.floor(seconds / 60);
	timeTemp = minutes * 60;
	seconds = seconds - timeTemp;
	if(minutes < 10){
	minutes = "0"+minutes;
	}
	if(seconds < 10){
	seconds = "0"+seconds;
	}
	tempoFinal = minutes +':'+ seconds;
	jQuery("#estampaTempo_"+ id).html(tempoFinal);
	}
	function montaEstrelas(numeroDeEstrelas, id, className){
	dif = 5 - numeroDeEstrelas;
	for(i=1; i <= numeroDeEstrelas; i++ ){
	jQuery(className+" #estrela_"+ id).append("<span class=\"bgEstrela ico_estrela_cheia\">estrela</span>");
	}
	if (dif != 0){
	for(i=1; i <= dif; i++){
	jQuery(className+" #estrela_"+ id).append("<span class=\"bgEstrela ico_estrela_vazia\">estrela</span>");
	}
	}
	}
	function validaHD(resolucao, id, url, className){
	if(resolucao == "HD"){
	jQuery(className +' #altres_'+ id +'').append('<a href="/'+ url +'?hd=1" class="hd"></a>');
	}
	}

	function appendHtml(docs, item, className) {
	url=item.url_tvig;
	urlFinal=url.split('/');
	if (item.title.length > 40){
	_titulo=item.title;
	numCrop=_titulo.lastIndexOf(" ", 35)
	_titulo=_titulo.substring(_titulo, numCrop)+'...';
	}else{
	_titulo=item.title;
	}
	html='';
	html='<li>\
	<div class="imagem">\
	<a title="'+ item.title +'" href="/'+ item.url_tvig +'">\
	<img width="148" height="83" alt="'+ item.title +'" src="'+ item.url_thumbnails[1] +'"/>\
	</a>\
	<a class="play" id="estampaTempo_'+ item.id +'" href="/'+ item.url_tvig +'"></a>\
	</div>\
	<div class="descricao">\
	<h5><a title="'+ item.name_categories[0] +'" href="/'+ urlFinal[0] +'/">'+ item.name_categories[0] +'</a></h5>\
	<h4><a title="'+ item.title +'" href="/'+ item.url_tvig +'">'+ _titulo +'</a></h4>\
	<strong>'+ item.number_of_views +'</strong><span>exibições</span>\
	<div id="altres_'+ item.id +'"></div>\
	<div id="estrela_'+ item.id +'" class="estrela"></div>\
	</div>\
	</li>';

	jQuery(className).append(html);
	montaEstrelas(item.ratings, item.id, className);
	formatarTempo(item.duration, item.id);
	validaHD(item.file_outputs[1], item.id, item.url_tvig, className);
	}

	function maisrecente(data) {
	jQuery.each(data.response.docs, function(docs, item) {
	appendHtml(docs, item, '#maisrecente');
	});
	}
	/*function maisvotado(data) {
	jQuery.each(data.response.docs, function(docs, item) {
	appendHtml(docs, item, '#maisvotado');
	});
	}*/

	//maisVistos - Hoje-semana-mes-sempre
	function maisvisto(data) {
	jQuery.each(data.response.docs, function(docs, item) {
	appendHtml(docs, item, '#maisvisto');
	});
	}
	function maisvisto_hoje(data) {
	jQuery.each(data.response.docs, function(docs, item) {
	appendHtml(docs, item, '#maisvisto_hoje');
	});
	}
	function maisvisto_semana(data) {
	jQuery.each(data.response.docs, function(docs, item) {
	appendHtml(docs, item, '#maisvisto_semana');
	});
	}
	function maisvisto_mes(data) {
	jQuery.each(data.response.docs, function(docs, item) {
	appendHtml(docs, item, '#maisvisto_mes');
	});
	}
	function maisvisto_sempre(data) {
	jQuery.each(data.response.docs, function(docs, item) {
	appendHtml(docs, item, '#maisvisto_sempre');
	});
	}
	//maisVistos - Hoje-semana-mes-sempre
	//maisvotado - Hoje-semana-mes-sempre
	function maisvotado(data) {
	jQuery.each(data.response.docs, function(docs, item) {
	appendHtml(docs, item, '#maisvotado');
	});
	}
	function maisvotado_hoje(data) {
	jQuery.each(data.response.docs, function(docs, item) {
	appendHtml(docs, item, '#maisvotado_hoje');
	});
	}
	function maisvotado_semana(data) {
	jQuery.each(data.response.docs, function(docs, item) {
	appendHtml(docs, item, '#maisvotado_semana');
	});
	}
	function maisvotado_mes(data) {
	jQuery.each(data.response.docs, function(docs, item) {
	appendHtml(docs, item, '#maisvotado_mes');
	});
	}
	function maisvotado_sempre(data) {
	jQuery.each(data.response.docs, function(docs, item) {
	appendHtml(docs, item, '#maisvotado_sempre');
	});
	}
	//maisvotado - Hoje-semana-mes-sempre
</script>

	jQuery.ajax({type:"GET",url:"//tvig.ig.com.br/_search/?sort=maisrecente&size=3&jsonp=maisrecente",dataType:'jsonp',jsonpCallback:'maisrecente'});
	jQuery.ajax({type:"GET",url:"//tvig.ig.com.br/_search/?sort=maisvotado&size=3&filterByDate=last-24hours&jsonp=maisvotado_hoje",dataType:'jsonp',jsonpCallback:'maisvotado_hoje'});
	jQuery.ajax({type:"GET",url:"//tvig.ig.com.br/_search/?sort=maisvotado&size=3&filterByDate=last-week&jsonp=maisvotado_semana",dataType:'jsonp',jsonpCallback:'maisvotado_semana'});
	jQuery.ajax({type:"GET",url:"//tvig.ig.com.br/_search/?sort=maisvotado&size=3&filterByDate=last-month&jsonp=maisvotado_mes",dataType:'jsonp',jsonpCallback:'maisvotado_mes'});
	jQuery.ajax({type:"GET",url:"//tvig.ig.com.br/_search/?sort=maisvotado&size=3&jsonp=maisvotado_sempre",dataType:'jsonp',jsonpCallback:'maisvotado_sempre'});
	jQuery.ajax({type:"GET",url:"//tvig.ig.com.br/_search/?sort=maisvisto&size=3&filterByDate=last-24hours&jsonp=maisvisto_hoje",dataType:'jsonp',jsonpCallback :'maisvisto_hoje'});
	jQuery.ajax({type:"GET",url:"//tvig.ig.com.br/_search/?sort=maisvisto&size=3&filterByDate=last-week&jsonp=maisvisto_semana",dataType:'jsonp',jsonpCallback :'maisvisto_semana'});

	jQuery.ajax({type:"GET",url:"//tvig.ig.com.br/_search/?sort=maisvisto&size=3&jsonp=maisvisto_sempre",dataType:'jsonp',jsonpCallback:'maisvisto_sempre'});

	jQuery('#maisvotado_hoje').css("display","block");
	jQuery('#maisvisto_div').css("display","block");
	jQuery('#maisvisto_hoje').css("display","block");
</script>

<script>
	function maisVistosAbas(param){
	if(param=='maisvisto_hoje'){
	jQuery('#hoje').addClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#semana').removeClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#mes').removeClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#sempre').removeClass("ativo");

	jQuery('#maisvisto_hoje').css("display","block");
	jQuery('#maisvisto_semana').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisvisto_mes').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisvisto_sempre').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisVistoUrl').attr('href', '/tudo/?type=maisvisto&filterByDate=last-24hours');
	jQuery('#maisVistoUrl').html('Ver todos de hoje');
	}else if(param=='maisvisto_semana'){
	jQuery('#hoje').removeClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#semana').addClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#mes').removeClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#sempre').removeClass("ativo");

	jQuery('#maisvisto_hoje').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisvisto_semana').css("display","block");
	jQuery('#maisvisto_mes').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisvisto_sempre').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisVistoUrl').attr('href', '/tudo/?type=maisvisto&filterByDate=last-week');
	jQuery('#maisVistoUrl').html('Ver todos da semana');
	}else if(param=='maisvisto_mes'){
	jQuery('#hoje').removeClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#semana').removeClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#mes').addClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#sempre').removeClass("ativo");

	jQuery('#maisvisto_hoje').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisvisto_semana').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisvisto_mes').css("display","block");
	jQuery('#maisvisto_sempre').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisVistoUrl').attr('href', '/tudo/?type=maisvisto&filterByDate=last-month');
	jQuery('#maisVistoUrl').html('Ver todos do mês');
	}else if(param=='maisvisto_sempre'){
	jQuery('#hoje').removeClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#semana').removeClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#mes').removeClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#sempre').addClass("ativo");

	jQuery('#maisvisto_hoje').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisvisto_semana').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisvisto_mes').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisvisto_sempre').css("display","block");
	jQuery('#maisVistoUrl').attr('href', '/tudo/?type=maisvisto&filterByDate=maisvisto_sempre');
	jQuery('#maisVistoUrl').html('Ver todos');
	}
	}
	function maisVotadosAbas(param){
	if(param=='maisvotado_hoje'){
	jQuery('#mvhoje').addClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#mvsemana').removeClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#mvmes').removeClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#mvsempre').removeClass("ativo");

	jQuery('#maisvotado_hoje').css("display","block");
	jQuery('#maisvotado_semana').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisvotado_mes').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisvotado_sempre').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisVotadoUrl').attr('href', '/tudo/?type=maisvotado&filterByDate=last-24hours');
	jQuery('#maisVotadoUrl').html('Ver todos de hoje');
	}else if(param=='maisvotado_semana'){
	jQuery('#mvhoje').removeClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#mvsemana').addClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#mvmes').removeClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#mvsempre').removeClass("ativo");

	jQuery('#maisvotado_hoje').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisvotado_semana').css("display","block");
	jQuery('#maisvotado_mes').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisvotado_sempre').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisVotadoUrl').attr('href', '/tudo/?type=maisvotado&filterByDate=last-week');
	jQuery('#maisVotadoUrl').html('Ver todos da semana');
	}else if(param=='maisvotado_mes'){
	jQuery('#mvhoje').removeClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#mvsemana').removeClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#mvmes').addClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#mvsempre').removeClass("ativo");

	jQuery('#maisvotado_hoje').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisvotado_semana').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisvotado_mes').css("display","block");
	jQuery('#maisvotado_sempre').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisVotadoUrl').attr('href', '/tudo/?type=maisvotado&filterByDate=last-month');
	jQuery('#maisVotadoUrl').html('Ver todos do mês');
	}else if(param=='maisvotado_sempre'){
	jQuery('#mvhoje').removeClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#mvsemana').removeClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#mvmes').removeClass("ativo");
	jQuery('#mvsempre').addClass("ativo");

	jQuery('#maisvotado_hoje').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisvotado_semana').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisvotado_mes').css("display","none");
	jQuery('#maisvotado_sempre').css("display","block");
	jQuery('#maisVotadoUrl').attr('href', '/tudo/?type=maisvotado&filterByDate=maisvotado_sempre');
	jQuery('#maisVotadoUrl').html('Ver todos');
	}
	}
</script>

<script type="text/javascript">
if(document.getElementById("flashcontent")){
  var so = new SWFObject('//i0.statig.com.br/tvig/images/textoHeader.swf', "mymovie", "200", "40", "8", "#FFFFFF");
  so.addVariable("titulo", document.getElementById("flashcontent").innerHTML);
  so.addVariable("linha", '404040');
  so.addVariable("texto", '6a6a6a');
  so.addParam("wmode", "transparent");
  so.addParam("quality", "high");
  so.addParam("salign", "LT");
  so.addParam("scale", "noscale");
  so.write("flashcontent");
}


function resizeFlash(w) {
  w = w * 105/100;
  var elem = document.getElementById("flashcontent");
  elem.style.width=w+"px";
  elem.childNodes[0].style.width=w+"px";
  elem.style.height="40px";
  elem.childNodes[0].style.height="40px";
  controlaOferecimento = 1;
}
</script>

<script type="text/javascript">
function ajustaPosicaoWSS(){
	leftWSS = parseInt($('#barra-global-container').offset().left + $('#barra-global-container').width()) + 10;
	$('#iGBahiaWss').css({"position":"absolute","top":"110px","left":leftWSS+'px',"z-index":"999","width":"160px","height":"600px"});
}
$(window).scroll(function(){
	window.pageYOffset >= 106 ? $('#iGBahiaWss').css({"position":"fixed","top":"5px"}) : $('#iGBahiaWss').css({"position":"absolute","top":"110px"})	
});
$(window).resize(function(){
	ajustaPosicaoWSS();
});
ajustaPosicaoWSS();
</script>

b=document.getElementById(a);"iG_social"==a||document.getElementById("iG_social").parentElement.setAttribute("class",""),"active"==b.parentElement.getAttribute("class")?b.parentElement.setAttribute("class",""):b.parentElement.setAttribute("class","active")}function toogle(a,b){if(document.getElementById("iG_social").parentElement.setAttribute("class",""),null!=a&&null!=b){var c=document.getElementById(a),d=c.getAttribute("class");null==d?c.setAttribute("class",b):d.replace(/[\n\t]/g," ").indexOf(b)==-1?c.setAttribute("class",c.getAttribute("class")+" <br>

<div class="row-fluid">
    <div class="span6">
        <h2>How Can I Help?</h2>
        <p>Everyone has a skill, and the Joomla! project would love to discover it! Whether it’s answering a simple question in the forum, helping to design a flyer for a Joomla! conference, translating text from one language to another, teaching CSS, HTML, javascript or PHP, and everything in between; there is a place for everyone.</p>
        <p>Browse the Joomla! teams to find a group of your interest and get involved!</p>
        <p>
            <a href="/register" class="btn"><span class="icon-chevron-right"></span>Create a Joomler account!            </a>
        </p>
    </div>
    <div class="span6">
        <h2>Why Should I Help?</h2>
        <p>The Joomla! project is an all volunteer organisation. That is what sets us apart from other large Open Source projects. By volunteering, you join a large, international and diverse group of passionate individuals, looking to empower people and companies to connect, communicate, and be competitive on the world wide web.</p>
        <p>See what other Joomla! Volunteers - Joomlers - are contributing to the Joomla! project.</p>
        <p>
            <a href="/joomlers" class="btn"><span class="icon-chevron-right"></span>Get to know Joomlers!            </a>
        </p>
    </div>
</div>

<br>

                    <h3 class="report-title">
                        <a href="/teams/certification-operations-team/reports/476-call-for-volunteers-certification-operations-team">
							Call for Volunteers - Certification Operations Team                        </a>
                    </h3>
                    <p class="muted">
						By                        <a href="/joomlers/312-luca-marzo">Luca Marzo</a>
						on 2017-03-26 10:43						in                        <a href="/teams/certification-operations-team">Certification Operations Team</a>
                    </p>
                    <p>The Certification Operations Team is responsible to create, maintain and follow the workflow and the processes for the Operations of the Joomla! Certification Program.
In order to improve the efficiency and the effectiveness of the process management, COT needs a new Joomla! extension to handle the Partners application process.
The workflow extension will receive the...</p>

        <div class="well joomlastory">
            <h2>A Joomler Story</h2>
            <ul class="media-list">
                <li class="media">
                    <a class="pull-left" href="/joomlers/60-sander-potjer">
						<img class="img-rounded" alt="Sander Potjer" src="/images/volunteers/thumbs/a860_sander-2016-500px_50x50.jpg"/>                    </a>
                    <div class="media-body">
                        <h3 class="media-heading">
                            <a href="/joomlers/60-sander-potjer">
								Sander Potjer                            </a>
                        </h3>
                        <p class="muted">
                            <span class="icon-location"></span> Naarden, Netherlands                        </p>
                    </div>
                </li>
                <li class="media">
                    <p>My Joomla story started back in the summer of 2005. During my school holiday weeks I came across Mambo, which seems a very nice way to build websites. I used it to rebuild the Frontpage (sorry!) website for my rowing team, which was a very simple website and mainly my play-garden. At the time the website was finished, Mambo was forked into Joomla. I had no clue about forks, community and open source at that time, but simply followed the majority and converted the website into Joomla.
Slowly I...</p>
                    <a href="/joomlers/60-sander-potjer#joomlastory" class="btn">
                        <span class="icon-chevron-right"></span>Read full Joomla Story                    </a>
                </li>
            </ul>
        </div>

    function initialise() {
        var mapOptions = {
                zoom: 2,
                zoomControl: true,
                zoomControlOptions: {
                    style: google.maps.ZoomControlStyle.SMALL
                },
                center: {lat: 25, lng: 15},
                mapTypeId: google.maps.MapTypeId.ROADMAP,
                panControl: false,
                mapTypeControl: false,
                scaleControl: false,
                streetViewControl: false,
                overviewMapControl: false,
                rotateControl: false,
                draggable: !("ontouchend" in document)
            },
            mcOptions = {
                maxZoom: 14,
                styles: [{
                    height: 53,
                    url: "media/com_volunteers/images/m1.png",
                    width: 53
                },

                        height: 56,
                        url: "media/com_volunteers/images/m2.png",

                        width: 90
                    }
                ]
            }

        var oms = new OverlappingMarkerSpiderfier(map, {keepSpiderfied: true, circleFootSeparation: 100});

            map.set('draggable', true);

China","image":"https:\/\/volunteers.joomla.org\/images\/volunteers\/thumbs\/c741_photo_50x50.jpg"},{"title":"Yves Hoppe","lat":"48.1351253","lng":"11.5819806","url":"\/joomlers\/683-yves-hoppe","address":"Munich, Germany","image":"https:\/\/volunteers.joomla.org\/images\/volunteers\/thumbs\/7021_yves-hoppe_50x50.jpg"},{"title":"Zurab Cherkezishvili","lat":"32.1656221","lng":"-82.9000751","url":"\/joomlers\/1556-zurab-cherkezishvili","address":"Georgia","image":"https:\/\/volunteers.joomla.org\/images\/joomla_50x50.png"} ];

        var icon = {
            url: "media/com_volunteers/images/joomla.png", // url
            scaledSize: new google.maps.Size(50, 50), // scaled size
            origin: new google.maps.Point(0, 0), // origin
            anchor: new google.maps.Point(25, 25) // anchor
        };

        for (i = 0; i < locations.length; i++) {
            marker = new google.maps.Marker({
                position: new google.maps.LatLng(locations[i].lat, locations[i].lng),
                map: map,
                icon: icon
            });

            google.maps.event.addListener(marker, 'click', (function (marker, i, infoWindow) {
                return function () {
                    infoWindow.setContent('<div style="width:200px;"><img width="40" class="pull-left" style="padding-right: 10px" src="' + locations[i].image + '" /><a href="' + locations[i].url + '">' + locations[i].title + '</a><br />' + locations[i].address + '</div>');
                    infoWindow.open(map, marker);
                }
            })(marker, i, infoWindow));

            markers.push(marker);
            bounds.extend(marker.position);
            oms.addMarker(marker);
        }

        var markerCluster = new MarkerClusterer(map, markers, mcOptions);

        var styles = [
            {
                featureType: "road",
                elementType: "geometry",
                stylers: [
                    {lightness: 100},
                    {visibility: "simplified"}
                ]
            }, {
                featureType: "road",
                elementType: "labels",
                stylers: [
                    {visibility: "simplified"}
                ]
            }, {
                featureType: "poi",
                elementType: "labels",
                stylers: [
                    {visibility: "on"}
                ]
            }, {
                featureType: "poi.business",
                elementType: "labels",
                stylers: [
                    {visibility: "off"}
                ]
            }, {
                featureType: "water",
                elementType: "labels",
                stylers: [
                    {visibility: "on"}
                ]
            }
        ];
        map.fitBounds(bounds);
        map.setOptions({styles: styles});
    }

    google.maps.event.addDomListener(window, 'load', initialise);
</script>

<header class="hidden-xs">
    <h1 class="col-xs-12">We are</h1>

    <div class="col-xs-12 center-content">
        <img src="/theme/ingewikkeld/images/ingewikkeld_text.png" class="logo" />
    </div>
</header>

<a id="what-we-do" class="anchor"></a>
<section class="container what-we-do">
    <section class="row">
    <div class="col-md-6">
        <p>
            <em class="name">Ingewikkeld</em> is a company of <strong>experts</strong> for building web
            applications. Our language of choice is PHP,
            although we regularly play with other languages and tools.
        </p>

        <p>
            With <em class="name">Ingewikkeld</em>, you hire experts that are
            active and integral parts of the global PHP community, either by maintaining open source projects, by
            speaking at conferences worldwide or by organizing their own conferences.
        </p>
    </div>
    <div class="col-md-6">
        <p>
            Every single expert from <em class="name">Ingewikkeld</em> has one goal:
        </p>

        <blockquote>Problems need to be solved.</blockquote>

        <p>
            We use a wide variety of tools to solve problems, whether it is one of the many PHP frameworks
            (we've worked on projects using <strong>symfony 1</strong>, <strong>Symfony2</strong>,
            <strong>Zend Framework 1 and 2</strong>, <strong>Silex</strong> and <strong>Cilex</strong> amongst
            others), a selection of the variety of tools that were not actually written in PHP
            (<strong>Memcache</strong>, <strong>Varnish</strong>, <strong>Redis</strong>, etc), or any other
            piece of software that we need (Bolt, Vagrant, etc), we can do it.
        </p>
    </div>
</section>

<section class="row">
    <div class="col-xs-12">
        <p>
            The <em class="name">Ingewikkeld</em> experts are not just about software development. They also do
            <strong>consulting</strong>, <strong>training</strong> and <strong>audits</strong> when required.
            And they are <em>pro-active</em>: If they see something needs to happen, they'll take the initiative
            and <em>make it happen</em>.
        </p>

        <p class="hiring">
            <img src="/theme/ingewikkeld/images/ingewikkeld_logo.png" class="hidden-xs" />
            Interested in hiring <em class="name">Ingewikkeld</em> experts, or working for <em class="name">Ingewikkeld</em>?
            Contact us at
            <a href="mailto:info@ingewikkeld.net">info@ingewikkeld.net</a>.
        </p>
    </div>
</section>
</section>

ddaccordion.init({
	headerclass: "expandable", //Shared CSS class name of headers group
	contentclass: "submenu", //Shared CSS class name of contents group
	collapseprev: true, //Collapse previous content (so only one open at any time)? true/false 
	defaultexpanded: [], //index of content(s) open by default [index1, index2, etc] [] denotes no content
	animatedefault: false, //Should contents open by default be animated into view?
	persiststate: false, //persist state of opened contents within browser session?
	toggleclass: ["", "openheader"], //Two CSS classes to be applied to the header when it's collapsed and expanded, respectively ["class1", "class2"]
	togglehtml: ["suffix", "", ""], //Additional HTML added to the header when it's collapsed and expanded, respectively  ["position", "html1", "html2"] (see docs)
	animatespeed: "normal" //speed of animation: "fast", "normal", or "slow"
})

      <li><a href="https://extensions.joomla.org"><span>Extensions</span></a></li><div class="sep">|</div>

      <li><a href="https://developer.joomla.org"><span>Developer</span></a></li><div class="sep">|</div>
      <li><a href="https://shop.joomla.org"><span>Shop</span></a></li>
    </ul>
    <div class="toplogo">
      <a href="https://www.joomla.org/"><img src="/themes/joomla/images/joomla_logo.png" alt="Joomla!"></a> <!-- end logo -->
</div><!-- end header -->
  </div>
<script>
	function getPos(obj, direction) {	/*		direction == 0 ---> Top		direction != 0 ---> Left	*/
		var cur = 0;
		if (obj.offsetParent) {
			do {
				if (direction == 0)
					cur += obj.offsetTop;
				else
					cur += obj.offsetLeft;
			} while (obj = obj.offsetParent);
		}
		return cur;
	}
	function expandFloatingMenu(id, icon) {
		var menu = document.getElementById(id);
		var icon = document.getElementById(icon);		
		var t = getPos(icon, 0);
		var l = getPos(icon, 1);
		menu.style.top = ((t + parseInt(icon.height)) + "px");
		menu.style.left = (l + "px");
		if (menu.style.visibility == "visible")
			menu.style.visibility = "hidden";
		else
			menu.style.visibility = "visible";
	}
	
</script>



<div id="header" style="min-width:803px;">

<script type="text/javascript">
		</script>

<script>
	$(document).ready(function(){
	 	$("#notificationssummary").jcfbtooltip({position:'bottom', 'width':'350px' ,method: getPastNotifications});
		$("#quickjumpmenupopup").jcfbtooltip({position:'bottom', 'width': '180px'});
		$("#searchmenuicon").jcfbtooltip({position:'bottom', 'width': '250px'});

		$( "#notificationsTemplate" ).template( "notificationtemplate" );
		$( "#nonotificationsTemplate" ).template( "nonotificationtemplate" );
		$( "#notificationsAreaTemplate" ).template( "tooltiptemplate" );
		$( "#quickJumpMenuTemplate" ).template( "jumpmenutemplate" );
		$( "#searchMenuTemplate" ).template( "searchmenutemplate" );

		var data = {};
		$.tmpl( "tooltiptemplate", data ).appendTo( $('#jcapp-notificationssummary') );
		$.tmpl( "jumpmenutemplate", data ).appendTo( $('#jcapp-quickjumpmenupopup') );
		$.tmpl( "searchmenutemplate", data ).appendTo( $('#jcapp-searchmenuicon') );
		

		$(document).on('click', '.sound-toggle', function(e) {
			submitSystemSoundSetting(this);	
			return false;
		});

		$(document).on('click', '.my-message-wall"', function(e) {
			window.location = '/gf/my/messagewall';
			return false;
		});

		$(':not(#jcapp-notificationssummary)').click(function(ev) {
			var str_class = '';
			if ($(this).attr("class")) {
				str_class = $(this).attr("class");
			}

			if ($(this).parents('#jcapp-notificationssummary').length == 0 && str_class.indexOf("notifications") == -1 && str_class.indexOf('sound-toggle') == -1) {
		    $('#jcapp-notificationssummary').hide();
		    $('#jcapp-notificationssummary').attr('visibility-status', 'hidden');
			}

			if ($(this).parents('#jcapp-notificationssummary').length > 0) {
				ev.stopPropagation();
				if (str_class.indexOf('sound-toggle') != -1) {
					submitSystemSoundSetting(this);
				}
			}
		});
	
	
		$(':not(#jcapp-quickjumpmenupopup)').click(function(ev) {
			var str_class = '';
			if ($(this).attr("class")) {
				str_class = $(this).attr("class");
			}

			if ($(this).parents('#jcapp-notificationssummary').length == 0 && str_class.indexOf("quickjumpmenuicon") == -1) {
		    $('#jcapp-quickjumpmenupopup').hide();
		    $('#jcapp-quickjumpmenupopup').attr('visibility-status', 'hidden');
			}

			if ($(this).parents('#jcapp-notificationssummary').length > 0) {
				ev.stopPropagation();
			}

		});


		$(':not(#jcapp-searchmenuicon)').click(function(ev) {
			var str_class = '';
			if ($(this).attr("class")) {
				str_class = $(this).attr("class");
			}

			if ($(this).parents('#jcapp-searchmenuicon').length == 0 && $(this).parents('.tooltip-content').length == 0 && str_class.indexOf("SearchByIDMenu") == -1) {
		    $('#jcapp-searchmenuicon').hide();
		    $('#jcapp-searchmenuicon').attr('visibility-status', 'hidden');
			}
			
			if ($(this).parents('#jcapp-searchmenuicon').length > 0) {
				ev.stopPropagation();
			}

		});
	
		
	});  
</script>

		<td width="70%" valign="top">
<div class="frontpage"><h1>
	</h1>
<h1>
	<span>What is JoomlaCode.org?</span></h1>
<p>
<span>JoomlaCode.org was a resource for developers to build and manage Open Source software projects centred around Joomla.<br />
At the beginning of 2015, The Joomla! Project decided to start shutting down JoomlaCode (<a href="https://developer.joomla.org/news/602-joomlacode-is-closing.html"><span>https://developer.joomla.org/news/602-joomlacode-is-closing.html</span></a>) and started moving ahead with a new infrastructure to host the Joomla! code, the translation packages as well as all releases.</span></p>
<p>
<span>Please note:</span></p>
<ul><li>
		<span>Joomla! code is now developed at GitHub <a href="https://github.com/joomla"><span>https://github.com/joomla</span></a></span></li>
	<li>
		<span>All Joomla! releases are hosted at <a href="https://downloads.joomla.org/"><span>https://downloads.joomla.org/</span></a></span></li>
	<li>
		<span>All Joomla! accredited translations are currently hosted in here <a href="http://joomlacode.org/gf/project/jtranslation3_x/frs/?action=index"><span>http://joomlacode.org/gf/project/jtranslation3_x/frs/?action=index</span></a>  but will be soon migrated to the Downloads Portal</span></li>
</ul><p>
<span>Once all languages packages migrated, this resource will be permanently closed.</span></p>
<p>
As of March 2017, the creation of new projects has been disabled and user registration requires administrator approval.  Generally, new accounts and projects will not be approved at this time.</p>
</div> <div id="newscontainar">
 		<div id="newsinner">
			<div id="content" role="main">

			<div id="post" class="post">
				<h1 class="entry-title"><a href="/gf/project/joomlaxplorer/news/?id=4181" title="eXtplorer 2.1.6 released">eXtplorer 2.1.6 released</a></h1>

					<div class="entry-meta">
						<span class="meta-prep meta-prep-author">Posted on</span> <span class="entry-date">2014-11-14</span> <span class="meta-sep">by </span>soeren <span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="http://localhost/_research/wordpress/?author=1" title="View all posts by admin"></a></span>
					</div>
					<!-- .entry-meta -->

					<div class="entry-content">
							<p>
eXtplorer Version 2.1.6 has been released with the following changes:</p>
<p>
- fixed https usage for ports other than 443<br />
- fixed XSS issue related to PHP_SELF<br />
- added date range filtering to file search<br />
- simplified search function<br />
- fixed scrambled non-ASCII file names on UTF-8 systems</p>
<p>
Please update to this new eXtplorer version as it fixes an XSS security issue. Also the UTF-8 fix is recommended for users with non-ASCII filenames.</p>
					</div><!-- .entry-content -->

					<div style="margin-top: 5px;">

        <main>
            <section class="go">
    <div class="container">
        <h1>Joomla! Framework</h1>
        <h2>Download &amp; Go</h2>
        <span class="fa fa-cloud-download mega"></span>
        <div class="cta clearfix">
            <p>Designed by software developers for software developers. Easy to Adapt. Easy to Extend.</p>
            <p><a href="https://getcomposer.org/download/" class="btn btn-success pull-left">Download Composer</a> <a href="https://github.com/joomla-framework" class="btn btn-info pull-right">GitHub Organization</a></p>
        </div>
    </div>
</section>

<hr id="about" />

<span class="fa fa-info-circle marker"></span>
<section class="about container">
    <h2>What is the Joomla! Framework?</h2>
    <p>The Joomla! Framework&#8482 is a new PHP framework (a collection of software libraries/packages) for writing web and command line applications in PHP, without the features and corresponding overhead found in the Joomla! Content Management System (CMS). It provides a structurally sound foundation, which is easy to adapt and easy to extend.</p>
    <p>The Joomla! Framework is free and open source software, distributed under the GNU General Public License version 2 or later; and is comprised of code originally developed for the Joomla! CMS&#8482.</p>
    <p>The Joomla! Framework should not be confused with the hugely popular Joomla! CMS. It is important to remember that you do not need to install the Joomla! Framework to use the CMS, nor do you need to install the Joomla! CMS to use the Framework.</p>
    <img class="img-responsive center structure" src="/media/images/FrameworkDiagram-712x350.png" alt="The versatility and structure of the Joomla! Framework" />

    <section class="getting-started container">
        <h4>Getting Started</h4>
        <p>The new Joomla! Framework is now available to install via Composer and you can find the list of packages on <a href="https://packagist.org/packages/joomla/">Packagist.org</a>. There are plenty of avenues you can explore to get started on working with the Framework.</p>
        <p>For the official docs, check out the <code>README.md</code> file found in each package. You can also review the <a href="https://github.com/joomla-framework">Joomla! Framework organization on GitHub</a>.</p>
    </section>

    <h3>Get the Sample Application</h3>
    <p>The easiest way to get to know the Joomla! Framework is to start with the sample app.</p>
    <ol>
        <li>Install Composer.</li>
        <li>Download this <a href="https://github.com/dbhurley/framework-app">sample app</a> repository from GitHub.</li>
        <li>Run <code>composer install</code>.</li>
        <li>View in your browser.</li>
    </ol>

    <h3>Why build a Joomla! Framework?</h3>
    <p>Separating the framework from the CMS was a big deal, and in retrospect, a smart decision. By separating the two code bases Joomla!&reg; can now offer the stability the CMS requires while still taking advantage of current and modern trends in PHP development.</p>

    <a href="/media/images/FrameworkRoadmap-1200x650.png">
        <img class="img-responsive center structure" src="/media/images/FrameworkRoadmap-960x520.png" alt="The current and future roles of the Joomla! Framework" />
    </a>

    <h3>What is the Framework good for?</h3>
    <ul>
        <li>Building a RESTful web services platform</li>
        <li>Building both simple and complex command line tools</li>
        <li>Building next generation web applications</li>
    </ul>
    <p>A great example is the <a href="https://issues.joomla.org">issue tracker for the Joomla! CMS</a>.</p>

    <h3>Framework Architecture</h3>
    <p>The Joomla! Framework has also been designed for maximum flexibility. Breaking the Framework into isolated modular packages allows each package to evolve more easily than if all packages are tied to a single, large package release.</p>
    <p>Gone are the days when a PHP framework must offer anything and everything a developer needs to complete a project. The current and widely adopted modern practice is to employ lightweight independent feature-specific packages.</p>
    <p>The Framework is distributed with <a href="https://getcomposer.org">Composer</a>, and as such, allows you to include any other PHP code packages that you can install using Composer. And that's a LOT! Take a look at <a href="https://packagist.org/">Packagist.org</a> to see the kind and quality of code which becomes available when using Composer for dependency management.</p>

    <h3>What does the Joomla! Framework mean for you?</h3>
    <p>Whether you are a Joomla! extension developer looking to spread your wings &amp; delve into developing standalone applications or a PHP coder looking for a stable lightweight framework for your next app, the Framework provides benefits for everyone.</p>

    <h3>I am already developing Extensions for the Joomla! CMS. Why should I consider using the Joomla! Framework?</h3>
    <p>You have invested significant time &amp; effort in learning the Joomla! way of doing things &amp; writing extensions. You can now apply this same knowledge within a non-CMS environment because the Joomla! Framework maintains a similar set of function, class, and method names.</p>
    <p>It's important to keep in mind other situations, such as what happens when you land a project that needs a different type of application. Or when something doesn't really fit into the website or CMS box, or the CMS is simply too much overhead. There may be times when you need a simple tool to migrate data from one Business Intelligence system to another or a lightweight RESTful service to talk to a mobile application. These are all cases when a framework-based application will prove much more beneficial.</p>
    <p>These are only a few of the many situations where a framework based solution would work far better than attempting to shoehorn a solution into the Joomla! CMS. The Joomla! Framework allows you to leverage all that Joomla! knowledge to build apps without the overhead of the CMS.</p>

    <h3>I know PHP already. Why should I use this framework?</h3>
    <p>If you are a strong coder looking for a lightweight framework that is easy to adapt and extend, you are in the right place.</p>
    <p>The Joomla! Framework is available using Composer. This allows you to build projects from the many packages included in the Joomla! Framework as well as packages that best fit your needs from any of the other PHP frameworks that use Composer.</p>

    <h3>I am a Joomla! CMS User. How will I be affected?</h3>
    <p>The Joomla! CMS and the Joomla! Framework are currently developed independently and, thus, the Framework's launch will not have an immediate impact for you. However, there are already parts of the Framework integrated into the CMS (e.g. the Dependency Injection package, added in Joomla! 3.2), and more is coming. Expect to see some great extensions made available to you, built using the Framework!</p>
    <p>The Joomla! Framework aims at getting the latest in PHP developments and features into Joomla! at the framework level. This allows the CMS to better focus its aims on providing the best features for its end users and staying ahead of the game.</p>
    <p>Bottom line, you can rest assured that your favorite CMS will continue to have a strong, up-to-date and robust base that can evolve with the web.</p>
</section>

<hr id="involved" />

<span class="fa fa-globe marker"></span>
<section class="container">
    <h2>Get Involved</h2>

    <h3>Support</h3>
    <p class="lead">The Joomla! Framework incorporated support in a simple step-by-step process. You can quickly determine the best way to get help by following one of the options below:</p>

    <h4>First Option: Just Fix it</h4>
    <p>Developers are encouraged to take an active approach with the Framework, including future updates and development. If you find a problem or bug and can fix the issue directly, then you can fix the issue and submit a pull request against the repository.</p>
    <p>Not sure how to get started with submitting a pull request? You can view <a href="https://docs.joomla.org/Working_with_git_and_github/My_first_pull_request" target="_blank">pull request tutorials</a> in the Joomla! Documentation wiki.</p>

    <h4>Second Option: Report it</h4>
    <p>If you find an issue in a Framework package and cannot fix the issue directly, then the next step is to report the problem. Issues can be reported on the <a href="https://github.com/joomla-framework" target="_blank">Joomla! Framework organization</a> under the appropriate package. Submitting an issue here will help everyone track issues in a central location. Please be available to add comments and respond to questions related to your issue as other developers begin assisting in writing code to fix the issue.</p>
    <p>More information regarding <a href="https://developer.joomla.org/framework/report-an-issue.html">reporting issues</a> can be found here.</p>

    <h4>Other Option: Learn it</h4>
    <p>Perhaps as you're working with the Framework you find a feature or an issue that you are simply unsure about how to use it. In this case, it would not be appropriate to attempt either of the steps listed above. You can take advantage of the <a href="https://groups.google.com/group/joomla-dev-framework" target="_blank">Joomla! Framework mailing list</a> where you can get help from other developers.</p>
    <p>Be respectful and courteous in the mailing list and you will receive quick helpful feedback to help you better utilize the Framework to its full potential.</p>

    
    <aside class="involved-chunks clearfix">
        <div data-display="equal" class="well">
            <h4>Official Group</h4>
            <p>A tried and tested method of communication, it is a quick and easy way for you to ask any questions, offer suggestions, and voice your opinion.</p>
            <p><a href="https://groups.google.com/group/joomla-dev-framework" class="btn btn-success">Framework Google Group</a></p>
        </div>
        <div data-display="equal" class="well">
            <h4>GitHub Repository</h4>
            <p>Are you a GitHub Junkie? Wanna dive into the exact code, or grab it straight from the source? Then GitHub should be perfect for you.</p>
            <p><a href="https://github.com/joomla-framework" class="btn btn-success">Official GitHub organization</a></p>
        </div>
        <div data-display="equal" class="well">
            <h4>Support Joomla! through Open Source Matters</h4>
            <p>Open Source Matters serves the financial and legal interests of the Joomla! project. By supporting them you are directly supporting the Joomla! project itself.</p>
            <p><a href="https://www.joomla.org/sponsor.html" class="btn btn-success">Sponsor Joomla! today</a></p>
        </div>
        <div data-display="equal" class="well">
            <h4>RSS</h4>
            <p>Are you an RSS buff? Get the latest developer news at your fingertips.</p>
            <p><a href="https://developer.joomla.org/news.html" class="btn btn-success">Developer News</a></p>
        </div>
    </aside>
</section>
        </main>

            <h3>Case Studies</h3>
            <p>This framework powers Joomla's own issue tracker. See this Framework-based application in operation at <a href="https://issues.joomla.org">issues.joomla.org</a></p>
            <p>Also, it already has been adopted by the likes of eBay for internal use. Some of the code offered by Joomla! Framework is already included with the Joomla! CMS. Other packages will be included in future Joomla! CMS versions as needed.</p>
            <p><a href="https://groups.google.com/group/joomla-dev-framework">Join the Google Group</a> and let us know how you have implemented it.</p>
        </aside>

                    <div class="span6 language-and-actions-container">
                        		<h2 class="hide">Opções de acessibilidade</h2>

	<div class="module-box-01 module-box-01-white span4 variacao-module-00 module span4">
														<div class="header">				<h2 class="title">Agenda Ambiental</h2>
	        					
				</div>
			
			
<div class="prefix-1 eventos">
    
    <ul class="row-fluid lista">
              <li class="span12" style="border-left: 0px dotted #fff !important;">
			<p>15/04/2017</p>

        <div class="maincolumn ">
                                        <article class="row">
                    <h1><a href="/item/bolt-3-2-5-released">Bolt 3.2.5 released</a></h1>
                    <h2 class="subheader"></h2>
                    <p class="meta" title="29 December 2016 - 14:31">
                    Published: Thursday 29 December 2016 by
                    <a href="/profile/bob">Bob</a>
                    </p>

                    <div class="articlebody">
                        
                                                    <p>We've released Bolt 3.2.5 as a maintenance and security release.
Swiftmailer, one of the libraries Bolt uses, released a security update today, in which a serious vulnerability was fixed. For more information about this, see:  
 {{ tweet(814416314429308928) }}  
 Although we are not aware of a way to exploit this vulnerability in existing Bolt installations, it is our policy to pass on security patches immediately. We strongly recommend all Bolt users to upgrade their installations.  
 Notable changes: 
 
 Security: Update Swiftmailer to  ^5.4.5  per CVE-2016-10074.  #6204  
 Added: Added …</p>

 Exception Handling and Exception screen

detailed error message, you'll get a white screen of doom with no information …</p>

                    <h1><a href="/item/visual-asset-guidelines-for-the-marketplace">Visual Asset Guidelines for the Marketplace</a></h1>
                    <h2 class="subheader"></h2>
                    <p class="meta" title="25 August 2016 - 10:23">
                    Published: Thursday 25 August 2016 by
                    <a href="/profile/phillipp">Phillipp</a>
                    </p>

                    <div class="articlebody">
                        
                                                    <p>In order to improve the performance of our  Marketplace , we've worked out some recommended sizes for icons &amp; screenshots. This was necessary because the marketplace homepage contained 16MB of assets on an uncached request. 
 Short summary of the recommended sizes: 
 
 Icons
 
 400x400px in PNG format 
  
 Screenshots
 
 First screenshot should have the size of 600x405px 
 All other shouldn't be wider than 1200px 
  
 
 More information about screenshot content guidelines, instructions on how to take a screenshot, and tools to optimize the file size can be found on the corresponding  …</p>
                            <a href="/item/visual-asset-guidelines-for-the-marketplace" class="button">Read the full article</a>

                    </p>

 To build on this evolution, we are hosting our first 3.x hackathon today. There are no limitations in what you build, as long as it uses Bolt in some ways. You are also free to use any extensions and themes from our  marketplace .

                    <h1><a href="/item/security-bolt-3-0-11-2-2-23-released">[Security] Bolt 3.0.11 & 2.2.23 Released</a></h1>
                    <h2 class="subheader"></h2>
                    <p class="meta" title="19 July 2016 - 12:37">
                    Published: Tuesday 19 July 2016 by
                    <a href="/profile/gawain">Gawain Lynch</a>
                    </p>

                    <div class="articlebody">
                        
                                                    <p>Today we are releasing urgent maintenance fixes for Bolt 2 &amp; 3, in the form of 2.2.23 &amp; 3.0.11.  
 These releases contain updated components to assist in mitigating a new security risk, known as &quot; HTTPoxy &quot;. 
 Summary 
 HTTPoxy is a remotely exploitable  CGI  application vulnerability that affects PHP, Go, Python, and other programming languages used on the web. 
 Mitigating its effect should be taken very seriously, as there are known exploits doing the rounds. 
  Note:  For the PHP specific vulnerability see  CVE-2016-5385 . 
 Immediate Mitigation &amp; Recommended Action …</p>
                            <a href="/item/security-bolt-3-0-11-2-2-23-released" class="button">Read the full article</a>
                                            </div>
                </article>

                    <h1><a href="/item/some-things-that-will-em-not-em-be-in-bolt-3-0">Some things that will <em>not</em> be in Bolt 3.0</a></h1>
                    <h2 class="subheader"></h2>
                    <p class="meta" title="8 March 2016 - 12:02">
                    Published: Tuesday 8 March 2016 by
                    <a href="/profile/bob">Bob</a>
                    </p>

                    <div class="articlebody">
                        
                                                    <p>Over the past few years, we've seen a lot of feature-requests for Bolt. A lot of really good suggestions, as well as some that aren't possible or that just wouldn't be a good fit for a project like Bolt.  
 Even with all the good suggestions, we simply cannot add them all, for a number of reasons:  
 
 There's only so many hours in a day, and our resources aren't unlimited 
 A new feature will not  just  require implementation. It'll also mean we need to support it, document it, and do maintenance on it. We cannot spread ourselves too thin, because it would mean the quality of  other  aspects …</p>

Starting right now, we'll publish two short articles on this website every week, in which we detail one or two of the improvements that are coming very soon. We are very excited about all the new things and the big improvements, and we're sure you will be too. 
 …</p>

                            <article class="row">
                    <h1><a href="/item/bolt-2-2-17-released">Bolt 2.2.17 released.</a></h1>
                    <h2 class="subheader"></h2>
                    <p class="meta" title="28 January 2016 - 16:16">
                    Published: Thursday 28 January 2016 by
                    <a href="/profile/bob">Bob</a>
                    </p>

                    <div class="articlebody">
                        
                                                    <p>As ongoing maintenance for our Stable Bolt release, we have released Bolt 2.2.17. This update contains a few minor new features and bugfixes.  
 We've been working hard on Bolt 3.0 the past year, and we're almost at the point where it's time to share details on the improvements in this upcoming version. Stay tuned for details!  
 Detailed changes since Bolt 2.2.15 
 
 Fix: No href around '…'-placeholders in pagers. (See #4650) 
 Fix: Templatefields in 'Viewless' records work correctly now (#4653) 
 Change: Move  NutSP::addCommand  to  $app['nut.commands.add']  so it's not &quot;static&quot; …</p>

                    <h1><a href="/item/bolt-2-2-10-released">Bolt 2.2.10 released.</a></h1>
                    <h2 class="subheader"></h2>
                    <p class="meta" title="1 September 2015 - 09:01">
                    Published: Tuesday 1 September 2015 by
                    <a href="/profile/bob">Bob</a>
                    </p>

                    <div class="articlebody">
                        
                                                    <p>Hot on the heels of Bolt 2.2.9, we've released Bolt 2.2.10. The only change in this release is an update to the latest versions of our Database abstraction library and related packages.  Doctrine 2.5.1 fixes  a hard-to-exploit but serious security issue. Most Bolt websites  by far  are   not   vulnerable to this, unless you're using Bolt as a foundation to use Doctrine's ORM or code generation features.   
 If you don't know what this means, you can rest assured that this issue does not affect you, and there's no need to update right away.  
 Detailed changes since Bolt 2.2.9 
 
 Updated: …</p>

 New Features 
 A Chrome quirk 
 A recent update in Chrome came with a weird quirk that shows up in the Bolt backend. This quirk causes the dashboard listings to become too wide, which looks slightly broken. Since this only appears in Chrome 44, and not in older versions of Chrome or other browsers, we're pretty sure that it's a bug in Chrome itself. However, that doesn't help you much right now, so we've implemented a workaround …</p>

                    </p>

                    <div class="articlebody">
                        
                                                    <p>We've released Bolt 2.0.6 as part of ongoing maintenance and support. It contains a couple of nice fixes and improvements. Particularly: 
 
 Bolt would store a lot of files in the  app/cache -folder that were very deeply nested in folders. While this causes no problems by itself, there was no need to create so many folders. As of this release the amount of folders created is limited to 2 deep.  
 We've changed and improved the way  type: select  field work: You now have more fine-grained control of what's shown in the select-box on screen (for the editors) as well as what's stored under water …</p>

 For more information about updating (and release 1.6 in general), please see the  post about the Bolt 1.6.0 release .

 Allowing IE8/IE9 to upload images, instead of breaking on &quot;allowed filetypes&quot; Fixes  #1188 …</p>

                    <h2 class="subheader"></h2>
                    <p class="meta" title="3 April 2013 - 11:42">
                    Published: Wednesday 3 April 2013 by
                    <a href="/profile/bob">Bob</a>
                    </p>

                    <div class="articlebody">
                        
                                                    <p>(subtitle: And how you can help us do that)  
 Now that Bolt 1.0 has been out for a month and a half, it's time to think about our next steps. We want to release incremental updates, where each version has just a few major new features and improvements, together with the usual smaller improvements and fixes.  
 Since all of our code is on Github, we don't  have  to do a monolithic '2.0'-version to include a whole bunch of major new functionality all at once. Instead, we can release smaller upgrades much more often.  
 Like I mentioned, now that the dust has settled after the first 1.0 …</p>

                    <h2 class="subheader"></h2>
                    <p class="meta" title="21 March 2013 - 13:51">
                    Published: Thursday 21 March 2013 by
                    <a href="/profile/bob">Bob</a>
                    </p>

                    <div class="articlebody">
                        
                                                    <p>We've released yet another incremental update for Bolt. Version 1.0.3 fixes a few minor quirks and issues. The changelog is: 
 
 Added: Removed our own transliteration code, using URLify instead. Allows for much better slugs for non-western european languages. 
 Added: Bolt now shows an error message if  magic_quotes_gpc  is enabled ( &quot;Magic quotes&quot;  were deprecated in PHP 5.3) 
 Added: An extra check for PHP 5.2 -&gt; Don't even attempt to load the 'lowlevelchecks', just throw an error and exit. 
 Change: Tidied up the default  .yml  files a bit 
 Fixed: On some servers the results …</p>

                    <h2 class="subheader"></h2>
                    <p class="meta" title="19 March 2013 - 09:20">

                    <a href="/profile/bob">Bob</a>
                    </p>

                    <div class="articlebody">
                        
                                                    <p>We've recently gotten hold of the 'bolt' account on Github, which means we'll be moving our repository from  github.com/bobdenotter/bolt  to  github.com/bolt/bolt . We'll make this change on sunday the  24th of march .  
 If you're using Bolt through composer, please change your composer.json accordingly. If you're using a version of bolt directly checked out from our repository, you'll need to change the origin as well: 
  git remote set-url origin git://github.com/bolt/bolt.git  
 Finally, if you have no idea what this all means: You won't have to change anything, and your version of Bolt …</p>

 The context-menus on the dashboard and overview screens now have a 'view on site' option for published records.

                    <h1><a href="/item/bolt-10-stable-released">Bolt 1.0 stable released.</a></h1>
                    <h2 class="subheader"></h2>
                    <p class="meta" title="20 February 2013 - 19:05">
                    Published: Wednesday 20 February 2013 by
                    <a href="/profile/bob">Bob</a>

                    <div class="articlebody">

                                                    <p>After 6 months of hard work, we're proud to release Bolt 1.0 stable. Our &quot;Sophisticated, lightweight &amp; simple CMS&quot; is now officially out of beta. Bolt is written in PHP, and uses either SQLite, MySQL or PostgreSQL as a database and it's built upon the Silex framework together with a number of Symfony components. If you're new to Bolt, we invite you to check out the  front page of our site  for a brief explanation and a slideshow with pretty pictures. Don't forget to check out our   new showcase page  , with screenshots of sites already running Bolt.  
 We've fixed (yet again) …</p>

                    <h2 class="subheader"></h2>
                    <p class="meta" title="6 February 2013 - 10:47">
                    Published: Wednesday 6 February 2013 by

                                                    <p>As we explained in our  last posting , we're working hard towards a stable version 1.0 of Bolt. Today we released the last version for testing purposes, before we're going to label Bolt &quot;stable&quot;. In the time between 0.9.5 and this release, we've fixed a lot of issues, cleaned up and refactored the codebase and the way extensions work. 
 We also have a shiny new default theme that works well both on desktop screensizes as well as mobile. See the screenshots of the theme in [full size](/files/2013-02/Screen Shot 2013-02-06 at 10.53.33 AM.png) and  mobile resolution .

                    <div class="articlebody">
                                                    <a href="/files/2013-01/engage.jpeg" class="magnific">
                                <img src="/thumbs/700x300c/2013-01/engage.jpeg"> </a>
                        
                                                    <p>Originally we had planned to release version 1.0 somewhere in january, but we decided to take a few weeks extra. The main reason for this, is that we felt the need to do some structural changes to the code of the Bolt application. In short: we're refactoring things, and this requires us to take some time to iron out the quirks that are inevitable when you do things like that.  
 The result of these changes will be that Bolt will be better structured and the code will be easier to comprehend and maintain.  Extensions will be more flexible, and we're also making the basis for easier updating …</p>
                            <a href="/item/towards-version-10" class="button">Read the full article</a>
                                            </div>
                </article>
                            <article class="row">
                    <h1><a href="/item/bolt-09-released">Bolt 0.9 released</a></h1>
                    <h2 class="subheader"></h2>
                    <p class="meta" title="24 December 2012 - 14:30">
                    Published: Monday 24 December 2012 by
                    <a href="/profile/bob">Bob</a>
                    </p>

                    <div class="articlebody">
                                                    <a href="/files/2012-12/imagelist.png" class="magnific">
                                <img src="/thumbs/700x300c/2012-12/imagelist.png"> </a>
                        
                                                    <p>Just in time for the holidays, we've released Bolt 0.9. This release includes some new features, and a  shitload  of bugfixes, tweaks and smaller improvements. 
 These are the most prominent ones: 
 
  Relationships between content . You can now add relationships between any two contenttypes, allowing the editor to create links between them. This is convenient for when you need to keep things like 'authors' and 'books' together, or 'events' and 'news'.  Read the docs  to see how it works.  
 
   
 
 
  RSS feeds . Thanks to  Patrick , we now have RSS-feeds. Configurable for each seperate …</p>
                            <a href="/item/bolt-09-released" class="button">Read the full article</a>
                                            </div>
                </article>
                            <article class="row">
                    <h1><a href="/item/beta-08-released">Beta 0.8 released</a></h1>
                    <h2 class="subheader"></h2>
                    <p class="meta" title="2 November 2012 - 10:40">
                    Published: Friday 2 November 2012 by
                    <a href="/profile/bob">Bob</a>
                    </p>

                    <div class="articlebody">
                        
                                                    <p>Exactly one month after our first release, we've released beta 0.8. This release has a bunch of new features, but (perhaps more important) we've made a lot of improvements to the codebase. Some of the changes / improvements: 
 
 
 Bolt now has support for Extensions. Included with the download are a few basic ones: SimpleForms (to create contact forms and such), Google Analytics tracker code, &quot;Tweet this&quot;-button, &quot;Facebook Like&quot;-button, Facebook comments and Disqus comments. To create your own extensions, we refer to two completely new sections in the documentation:  …</p>
                            <a href="/item/beta-08-released" class="button">Read the full article</a>
                                            </div>
                </article>
                            <article class="row">
                    <h1><a href="/item/first-release-w00t">First release, w00t~</a></h1>
                    <h2 class="subheader"></h2>
                    <p class="meta" title="2 October 2012 - 08:50">
                    Published: Tuesday 2 October 2012 by
                    <a href="/profile/bob">Bob</a>
                    </p>

                    <div class="articlebody">
                        
                                                    <p>We've just released the first public version of our new project, named Bolt. If you haven't read the front page of this site yet, Bolt is  &quot;a tool for Content Management, which strives to be as simple and straightforward as possible. It is quick to set up, easy to configure, uses elegant templates, and above all: It’s a joy to use.&quot;  
 It's 'beta', but it works pretty well already. That said, you will likely encounter bugs or some missing features. If you do, please report them on  the forum  or on  our issue tracker  and we'll fix them for the next release. Over the next few months …</p>
                            <a href="/item/first-release-w00t" class="button">Read the full article</a>
                                            </div>
                </article>

<script>
(function($) {
	$.fn.extend({
		tabs: function(autotab) {
			return this.each(function() {
				var elem = $(this), tab = $(document.createElement('ul')).prependTo(elem), divs = elem.children('div'), i = 0, timer = null;
				// show first
				$(divs.get(0)).show();
				
				divs.find('img').each(function() {
					$(this).click(function () {
						window.location.href = $(this).parents('div').find('a').attr('href');
					});
				});
				
				// create tabs
				for (i=0; i < divs.length; i++) {
					tab.append('<li'+(!i ? ' class="in"' : '')+'><b class="tl"></b><b class="tr"></b><span>'+ $(divs.get(i)).attr('rule') +'</span></li>');
				}
				
				// get tabs
				tabs = tab.children();
				
				// actions
				tabs.click(function() {
					tabs.removeClass('in');
					$(this).addClass('in');
					divs.hide();
					i = tabs.index(this);
					$(divs[i]).fadeIn('slow');
					
					if (autotab) {
						resetTimer();
					}
				});
				
				if (autotab) {
					addTimer();
				}
				
				function addTimer() {
					timer = window.setInterval(showNext, 10500);
				}
				
				function resetTimer() {
					window.clearTimeout(timer);
					addTimer();
				}
				
				function showNext() {
					if (tabs.length > i + 1)
						i++;
					else
						i = 0;
					
					tabs.removeClass('in');
					$(tabs[i]).addClass('in');
					divs.hide();
					$(divs[i]).fadeIn('slow');
				}
			});
		},
		placeholder: function() {
			return this.each(function() {
				$('[placeholder]', this)
					.focus(function() {
						if ($(this).val() == $(this).attr('placeholder'))
							$(this).val('').css('color', '#000');
					})
					.blur(function() {
						if (!$(this).val() || $(this).val() == $(this).attr('placeholder'))
							$(this).val(function() { return $(this).attr('placeholder') }).css('color', '#ccc');
					})
					.filter(':not([value])').val(function() { return $(this).attr('placeholder') }).css('color', '#ccc')
					.parents('form').
						bind('submit', function() {
							$('[placeholder]', this).val(function() { return $(this).val() != $(this).attr('placeholder') ? $(this).val() : '' });
						});
			});
		},
		
		// Text tools are functions to make simple and quick add tools to the text
		// use the name pattern "tt" when create another function
		tt1: function() {
			return this.each(function() {
				$(this).children('div').each(function() {
					// use attr on the main element to set values in this code
					var tt = $(
						'<div class="media">'+
							'<b>Instruções para apresentação de propostas</b>'+
							'<p>'+
								//'<small>Formatos:</small><br/>'+
								'<a style="margin:8px 0 0 17px;" target="_blank" class="icon-html28" href="'+ $(this).attr('html') +'">HTML</a>'+
								//'<a class="icon-pdf28">PDF</a>'+
							'</p>'+
						'</div>'
					).fadeTo('fast', .5);
					
					$(this).prepend(tt);
					
					$(this).hover(
						function() {
							tt.fadeTo('normal', 1)
						},
						function() {
							tt.fadeTo('normal', .5);
						}
					);
				})
			});
		}
	});
})(jQuery);

var ui = {
	page: {
		col: function() {
			var u = /\/(\d+)/.exec(window.location.href)[1];
		
			$('#menu li a').each(function() {
				if (/\/(\d+)/.exec($(this).attr('href'))[1] == u)
					$(this).addClass('in');
			});
		}
	}
};

<div id="body">
<!-- id: 565 -->

<div id="page" class="page pg2col">
		<div id="menu">
	<h4>Geral</h4><ul><li><a href="/1416">Prestação de Contas e Uso de Recursos</a></li><li><a href="/325">Importação e Exportação</a></li></ul><script>ui.page.col()</script>	</div>
		<script>$.trim(document.getElementById('menu').innerHTML) == '' ? $('#page').addClass('noBg') : '';</script>
	<div id="content">
				
		<h4 class="breadcrumb"><a href="/">Página inicial</a> &raquo <a href="http://www.fapesp.br/350">Apoio ao Usuário</a> &raquo <a href="http://www.fapesp.br/352">Geral</a></h4>
		<h1 class="title">Solicitação de Alteração da Concessão Inicial </h1>

		<div class="text">
						
						
			<p>O Sistema Agilis (<a target="_blank" href="http://internet.aquila.fapesp.br/agilis"><b>http://internet.aquila.fapesp.br/agilis</b></a>) é um sistema eletrônico que permite aos pesquisadores cadastrados na FAPESP elaborar e submeter Solicitações de Alteração da Concessão Inicial para processos que tramitam em papel (não pelo Sistema de Apoio a Gestão - SAGe). Este sistema substitui o antigo formulário eletrônico de solicitação de alterações.<br />
<br />
Nesse sistema é possível elaborar e submeter solicitações de:</p>
<p style="margin-left: 40px">   1. Alteração de vigência<br />
   2. Alteração de prazo de Relatório Científico<br />
   3. Alteração de prazo de Prestação de Contas<br />
   4. Alteração do responsável ou orientador<br />
   5. Alteração do projeto de pesquisa<br />
   6. Alteração de instituição<br />
   7. Alteração de reunião<br />
   8. Alteração de endereço<br />
   9. Inclusão de documentos em processos concedidos<br />
  10. Inclusão de documentos em propostas em análise<br />
  11. Solicitação de uso específico da reserva técnica de Bolsa<br />
  12. Solicitação de uso específico da reserva técnica de Auxílio<br />
  13. Solicitações de cancelamento de Bolsa ou Auxilio<br />
  14. Solicitação de interrupção de Bolsa<br />
  15. Solicitações de reativação de Bolsa<br />
  16. Solicitação de reconsideração (somente para processos em papel)<br />
  17. Transposição de Verba<br />
 </p>
<p>Para iniciar uma solicitação é preciso acessar o processo ao clicar no número do mesmo e, acima dos "Dados do Processo", em "Solicitações". O sistema trará a "Lista de Solicitações", podendo selecionar uma opção de cada vez. Após concluir a solicitação, uma mensagem de confirmação será enviada ao endereço eletrônico do pesquisador.<br />
Para se cadastrar no Agilis, é importante que os dados do pesquisador estejam atualizados no banco de dados da FAPESP. Caso não estejam, entre em contato com a Fundação por meio do Serviço de Atendimento Converse com a FAPESP, no endereço: <a href="http://www.fapesp.br/converse"><b>www.fapesp.br/converse</b></a>, na opção Para Pesquisadores e, em seguida, Solicitações e Alteração de e-mail cadastrado na FAPESP (Sistema Agilis).<br />
 </p>
<p><b>MANUAL</b></p>
<p>Informações detalhadas para realização de solicitações pelo Agilis podem ser consultadas no manual disponível em: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.fapesp.br/manuais/manual_agilis_solicitacoes.pdf"><b>www.fapesp.br/manuais/manual_agilis_solicitacoes.pdf</b></a>.<br />
 </p>
<p><b><a href="/docs/formularios/arquivos/SDACI.docx">FORMULÁRIO EM PAPEL PARA WORD 2007 OU SUPERIOR</a></b></p>
<p><b><a href="/docs/formularios/arquivos/SDACI-AUTOMATIZADO.docm">FORMULÁRIO EM PAPEL PARA WORD 2007 OU SUPERIOR - IMPRESSÃO AUTOMÁTICA (É NECESSÁRIO HABILITAR MACROS DO WORD)</a></b></p>
<p><b><br />
</b> <b>DÚVIDAS</b></p>
<p>Em caso de dúvidas ou problemas de funcionamento do Agilis, entre em contato com a FAPESP por meio do Serviço <a href="http://www.fapesp.br/converse"><b>Converse com a FAPESP</b></a>, na opção Para Pesquisadores e, em seguida, Informações e Suporte a serviços on-line para pesquisadores cadastrados.</p>		</div>
		
		<div class="post-date"><i>Página atualizada pela última vez em 27 de abril de 2012</i></div>

<script>
$('#index > a').click(function() {
	var self = this, $e = $(this);
	
	function show() {
		$e.addClass('in').next().find('ul').slideDown();
		$(document).bind('click.clickHandler', clickHandler);
	}
	
	function hide() {
		$e.removeClass('in').next().find('ul').slideUp();
		$(document).unbind('click.clickHandler');
	}
	
	function clickHandler(event) {
		if (event.target != self)
			hide();
	}
	
	if ($e.hasClass('in')) hide(); else show();
	//$(this).toggleClass('in').next().find('ul').slideToggle();
});


// IE fix
$('#ie .sitename').append('<b class="l"></b><b class="r"></b>');
$('#ie .box').append('<b class="tl"></b><b class="tr"></b><b class="bl"></b><b class="br"></b>');
</script>
<!--[if IE]></div><![endif]-->

var s = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0]; s.parentNode.insertBefore(ga, s);
